articles.author: Jude‚öú
articles.description:
GM frens!
X) or scrolling through Crypto and Web3 communities, you‚Äôve probably seen some weird acronyms or slang that made you pause like... ‚ÄúWait, what does that even mean?‚Äù
Don‚Äôt worry you‚Äôre not alone.
The Web3 space has its own unique language that‚Äôs part tech, part culture, and part meme. Whether you‚Äôre a newbie or just trying to keep up, this post will break down popular Web3 slangs and what they actually mean in plain and simple English.
1. GM ‚Äì> Good Morning
Usage:
‚ÄúGM frens! Let‚Äôs BUIDL something amazing today.‚Äù
2. GN ‚Äì> Good Night
GM, this is a parting message but also a cultural nod that the day is done. The vibes continue tomorrow.
3. WAGMI ‚Äì> We‚Äôre All Gonna Make It
Usage:
‚ÄúETH is is up but we keep building. WAGMI.‚Äù
4. NGMI ‚Äì> Not Gonna Make It
Usage:
‚ÄúHe sold his NFT at the bottom... NGMI.‚Äù
5. FUD ‚Äì> Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt
Usage:
‚ÄúIgnore the FUD. The fundamentals are solid.‚Äù
6. FOMO ‚Äì> Fear Of Missing Out
Usage:
‚ÄúI bought that token at the top because of FOMO... regrets.‚Äù
7. DYOR ‚Äì> Do Your Own Research
8. Ape ‚Äì> To Jump In Recklessly
Usage:
‚ÄúNew memecoin launched and people are aping in fast.‚Äù
9. HODL ‚Äì> Hold On for Dear Life****
10. BUIDL ‚Äì> Build (but spelled cooler)
Usage:
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in a bear market. Time to BUIDL.‚Äù
11. DeFi ‚Äì> Decentralized Finance
12. Rekt ‚Äì> Wrecked / Lost Big
Usage:
‚ÄúI overleveraged and got rekt‚Ä¶‚Äù
13. Bag Holder ‚Äì> Someone Holding Tokens That Lost Value
14. Degen ‚Äì> Degenerate Trader
15. Whale ‚Äì> Someone with a Lot of Money
16. Rug / Rugpull ‚Äì> Scam or Exit Scam
Usage:
‚ÄúThey deleted everything overnight. Rugged hard.‚Äù
17. Frens ‚Äì> Friends
18. LFG ‚Äì> Let‚Äôs Freaking Go!
Usage:
‚ÄúBTC hit $100k again. LFG!!!‚Äù 
19. Mint ‚Äì> To Create an NFT
20. IRL ‚Äì> In Real Life
Web3 isn‚Äôt just tech, it‚Äôs culture, community, and creativity. Learning the lingo helps you blend in, understand the vibe, and have some fun while you explore the space.
Did I miss any slang you‚Äôve seen? 
Until next time... GM. WAGMI. And don‚Äôt get rekt.
articles.title: WEB3 Slangs Decoded: How to Sound Like a Web3 OG

articles.author: Sharon
articles.description:
SafeLine gives you full control over SSL protocols and cipher suites for securing your web applications. Here's how to configure SSL certificates, select supported protocol versions, and customize cipher suites to meet your security needs.
To enable HTTPS access, simply upload your SSL certificate while configuring the corresponding port. SafeLine will handle the rest.

SafeLine supports a wide range of SSL/TLS versions. You can select your desired protocol under the SSL Protocol section. Options include:  
TLSv1

TLSv1.1

TLSv1.2

TLSv1.3

SSLv2

SSLv3




Depending on your security policy or compliance requirements, you may need to specify which encryption algorithms to allow. SafeLine supports custom SSL cipher suites. Below are examples of commonly used configurations:
Nginx (official):

AES128-SHA:AES256-SHA:RC4-SHA:DES-CBC3-SHA:RC4-MD5


Cloudflare (recommended):

[ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256|ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305|ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256|ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305]:ECDHE+AES128:RSA+AES128:ECDHE+AES256:RSA+AES256:ECDHE+3DES:RSA+3DES


Mozilla (modern / TLS 1.3):

TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256:TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384:TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256


Mozilla (intermediate / TLS 1.2):

ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384


Mozilla (legacy TLS 1.0‚Äì1.2):

ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256


Cipherli (recommended):

EECDH+AESGCM:EDH+AESGCM


High-strength configuration:

HIGH:!aNULL:!eNULL:!EXPORT:!CAMELLIA:!DES:!MD5:!PSK:!RC4:!RSA






With these settings, you can ensure your application uses secure and optimized encryption tailored to your specific environment.
For any technical support, you can post the question directly on our forum: https://safepoint.cloud/discussion (Our technicians will receive a notification and reply shortly). 
https://discord.gg/dy3JT7dkmY (We‚Äôll check messages there every day)
articles.title: Fine-Tuning SSL Protocols and Ciphers in SafeLine WAF

In March, the Thai Securities and Exchange Commission approved US dollar-backed stablecoins such as Tether‚Äôs USDt (USDT) and Circle‚Äôs USDC (USDC) for cryptocurrency trades, allowing the stablecoins to be listed on regulated exchanges across Thailand.
Major Maxbit shareholders. Source: Thai SEC
Launched in October 2023, Maxbit is a licensed digital asset exchange based in Thailand, operating under the oversight of the Thai SEC.
According to official SEC records, Thai energy conglomerate PTG Energy is the largest shareholder of Maxbit, with a 35% stake in the firm. Other Maxbit backers include two local private firms, Spearhead Labs and Unit Company, holding 29% and 28.7% in the digital asset business.
